SENT.plain: A patient with Prinzmetal's variant angina (PVA) developed a cardiac arrest due to coronary vasospasm and subsequent myocardial infarction
After resuscitation postanoxic brain injury was diagnosed

After an initial improvement of consciousness he deteriorated rapidly on the seventh day after admission due to severe brain ischaemia apparently caused by cerebral vasospasm, until ultimately brain death was diagnosed
To our knowledge, the association between PVA and cerebral vasospasm has never been described
The combination suggests that this patient had a generalized vasospastic disorder
